Bag O' Links - 4/4/2010

  • Automatically open last page for failed cucumber scenarios – shows what webrat sees when a scenario fails.
  • 25 most dangerous programming errors – some good tips and pointers.
  • Oracle uses SQLite to wrap Berkeley DB – a good sign?
  • CSS Sprites best practices – using sprites the way interwebs gods intended.
  • Facebooker tutorial – every time one of those comes out, an angle is burned to death.
  • 18 signup forms – cool ideas.
  • Ruby access control – only a guideline? – a view on ruby’s protected and private scopes.
  • What does ‘scaleable database’ mean? – James Golick with another view on recent hype.
  • Bundle me some sanity – instead of ranting, this guy suggests a way to make bundler and RVM play nice.
  • Rails applications SSL checklist – what you need in order to setup SSL for your application.
  • CSS generated content techniques – the content attribute exposed.
  • Scalr – self-scaling hosting environment with amazon EC-2.

Treasures

  • Phat – ASync rails application – rails application + fibers + EventMachine.
  • TextMate bundles – lots of bundles.
  • SimpleGeo – Geodata API service, looks neat.
  • lolcalhost – a hacky little command line emulator.
  • RGraph – neat HTML5 graph library.
  • xkcdfools: mock a UNIX terminal in jQuery – i actually intended something like that to be the next theme for this blog, i guess XKCD are quicker than me.
  • AwesomePrint – Pretty print your Ruby objects with style and in full color and proper indentation. in other words, death to y something
  • Limondae – sinatra for PHP infidels.
  • Denied – sinatra for python infidels.
  • Resume – a little sinatra application to run your resume wild.
